words.definition: An arrow is a thin, straight stick shot from a bow.
words.example: The arrow flew through the air and hit the target.

words.definition: A battle is a fight between two armies in a war.
words.example: The soldiers fought a long battle.

words.definition: A bow is a weapon made of curved wood and string that shoots arrows.
words.example: He used a bow to shoot the arrow.

words.definition: When people are brave, they are not afraid to face pain or danger.
words.example: The brave firefighter saved the girl from the burning building.

words.definition: A chief is the leader of a group of people.
words.example: The village chief made the important decision.

words.definition: A disadvantage is a situation where someone is likely to lose.
words.example: Mike had a disadvantage in the race because he hurt his knee.

words.definition: An enemy is a person who hates or wants to harm you.
words.example: The two countries were enemies for many years.

words.definition: An entrance is a place where you go into something.
words.example: The entrance to the park was through a big gate.

words.definition: If you hardly do something, you almost do not do it at all.
words.example: It was so dark that I could hardly see my hand in front of my face.

words.definition: To intend to do something is to plan to do it.
words.example: I intend to go to college next year.

words.definition: Laughter is the sound of people laughing.
words.example: The sound of their laughter filled the room.

words.definition: A log is a thick piece of wood that has fallen or been cut from a tree.
words.example: The fire was made of several big logs.

words.definition: The military is the armed forces of a country.
words.example: I want to join the military after I finish school.

words.definition: To obey is to do what you are told to do.
words.example: The children always obey their parents.

words.definition: To secure something means to get it after a lot of effort.
words.example: He was able to secure a good job.

words.definition: When someone or something is steady, they are under control.
words.example: The painter used a steady hand to paint the picture.

words.definition: To trust is to believe that someone is honest and will do what they say.
words.example: I trust my friends to keep my secrets.

words.definition: To twist is to turn something around and around.
words.example: She twisted the cap off the bottle.

words.definition: Unless is used to mean 'if... not'.
words.example: You cannot go out unless you finish your homework.

words.definition: A weapon is an object used to hurt people, like a gun or a knife.
words.example: The sword was a very old weapon.
